SEARCH
Package ru.bivchallenge.dto

Interface RecordSeparable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Benefeciar, Company
public interface RecordSeparable
The RecordSeparable interface defines a contract for objects that can be separated into an array of String elements. This can be useful for serialization, parsing, or any operation that requires breaking down an object into a set of individual components.

Implementations of this interface are expected to provide their own logic for separating the object's data into a string array.

Example Usage:


 public class Person implements RecordSeparable {
     private final String name;
     private final int age;

     public Person(String name, int age) {
         this.name = name;
         this.age = age;
     }

     @Override
     public String[] separate() {
         return new String[] {name, String.valueOf(age)};
     }
 }
